title: Authors and Citation
text: Chen Xi. Author, maintainer. Ding Yang. Contributor. Shiqi Yang. Contributor. Lin Wei. Contributor. Lei Kong. Contributor. Ge Gao. Contributor, copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xi C (2024). SPARKLE: Single-cell Phenotype Association Research Kit Large-scale Evaluation. R package version 0.1.8.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SPARKLE: Single-cell Phenotype Association Research Kit for Large-scale Evaluation},   author = {Chen Xi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.8}, }

title: Cell Moderation Effect Plot — Cell_moderation_effect_plot
text: function generates plot visualize cell moderation effect based given interaction information.

title: Cell Moderation Effect Plot — Cell_moderation_effect_plot
code: Cell_moderation_effect_plot(   interaction.best,   cell.color = "gray",   edge.width = 3,   arrow.size = 0.75,   arrow.width = 1.5,   edge.color = c("darkred", "black", "gray") )

title: Cell Moderation Effect Plot — Cell_moderation_effect_plot
text: cell.color color cells plot. Default "gray". edge.width width edges plot. Default 3. arrow.size size arrows indicating edge directions. Default 0.75. arrow.width width arrows indicating edge directions. Default 1.5. edge.color vector containing colors different significance levels Pvalues. Default c("darkred", "black", "gray"). interaction.best.info data frame containing information cell interactions.

title: Cell Moderation Effect Plot — Cell_moderation_effect_plot
text: plot visualizing cell moderation effect.

title: Cell Moderation Effect Plot — Cell_moderation_effect_plot
code: Cell_moderation_effect_plot(interaction.best.info) #> Error in Cell_moderation_effect_plot(interaction.best.info): object 'interaction.best.info' not found

title: Cell Phenotype Network Plot — Cell_phenotype_network_plot
text: function generates network plot visualize cell phenotype interactions based provided interaction data. plot highlights significant interactions edges colored weighted according p-values odds ratios ().

title: Cell Phenotype Network Plot — Cell_phenotype_network_plot
code: Cell_phenotype_network_plot(   cwas.test = NULL,   best.model = NULL,   interaction.best.model = NULL,   cell.color = c("#cd3023", "#b91e45", "#f9bcbd", "gray", "#9BBBE1", "#90C4E9",     "#8095CE"),   cell.size = c(25, 20, 15, 14),   edge.width = c(2, 3, 4),   arrow.size = 0.75,   arrow.width = 1.5,   edge.color = c("darkred", "#b91e45", "#f9bcbd", "#9BBBE1", "#4198b9", "#2d4e76"),   Interation.effect = T )

title: Cell Phenotype Network Plot — Cell_phenotype_network_plot
text: cwas.test Data frame containing CWAS test data. best.model provided, parameter ignored. best.model List containing best model information. component Chosen_model_info data frame columns celltype, Pvalue, Beta. Default NULL. interaction.best.model List containing best interaction model information. component Chosen_model_info data frame columns celltype, Pvalue, Beta. Default NULL. cell.color Character vector specifying colors cells. Default c("#cd3023", "#b91e45", "#f9bcbd", "gray", "#9BBBE1", "#90C4E9", "#8095CE"). cell.size Numeric vector specifying sizes cells. Default c(25, 20, 15, 14). edge.width Numeric vector specifying widths edges different significance levels. Default c(2, 3, 4). arrow.size Numeric value specifying size arrows. Default 0.75. arrow.width Numeric value specifying width arrows. Default 1.5. edge.color Character vector specifying colors edges based p-values . Default c("darkred", "#b91e45", "#f9bcbd", "#9BBBE1", "#4198b9", "#2d4e76"). Interation.effect Logical value indicating whether use interaction effect moderation effect. Default TRUE.

title: Cell Phenotype Network Plot — Cell_phenotype_network_plot
text: plot cell phenotype network.

what: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
title: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
text: function computes possible models involving combinations two specified cell types CWAS data.

title: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
code: cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal(   cwas.data,   selected_celltype = NULL,   linkfunction = "binomial",   interaction = F )

title: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
text: cwas.data CWAS dataset containing rates phenotypes cell types. selected_celltype character vector specifying cell types consider modeling (default NULL, uses unique cell types dataset). linkfunction link function use modeling (default "binomial"). interaction Logical indicating whether consider interaction effects cell types (default FALSE).

title: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
text: list calculated models combination two cell types.

title: Calculate All Models with Two Cell Types as Variables — cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal
code: cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal(cwas.test.data) #> Error in cwas_2celltype_allmodel_cal(cwas.test.data): object 'cwas.test.data' not found

what: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
title: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
text: function adds power confidence interval (CI) information given fitted models analysis.

title: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
code: cwas_addPower(   mymodel,   yournsim = 10,   OR_cutoff_up = NULL,   OR_cutoff_down = NULL,   CCI = T,   interaction = F,   Tablename = "Tablename" )

title: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
text: mymodel list fitted models obtained previous analyses. yournsim Number simulations perform power estimation (default 10). OR_cutoff_up Upper cutoff value odds ratio () (optional). OR_cutoff_down Lower cutoff value odds ratio () (optional). CCI Logical indicating whether consider cell change index (CCI) (default TRUE). interaction Logical indicating whether consider interaction effects (default FALSE). Tablename Name table created (default "Tablename").

title: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
text: list fitted models added power CI information.

title: Add Power Information to Fitted Models — cwas_addPower
code: cwas_addPower(cwas.test.data.single.model.best) #> Error in cwas_addPower(cwas.test.data.single.model.best): object 'cwas.test.data.single.model.best' not found

what: Simulate Power Curve with Increasing Sample Size — cwas_addSamples
title: Simulate Power Curve with Increasing Sample Size — cwas_addSamples
text: function simulates power curve varying sample size (X) power (Y) based specified parameters.

title: Simulate Power Curve with Increasing Sample Size — cwas_addSamples
code: cwas_addSamples(   cwas.data.selected,   selected_celltype,   yournsim = 10,   OR_cutoff_up = NULL,   OR_cutoff_down = NULL,   CCI = T,   interaction = F,   increased_sample_info = "rate" )

title: Simulate Power Curve with Increasing Sample Size — cwas_addSamples
text: cwas.data.selected list containing selected models CWAS analysis. selected_celltype character vector specifying cell types interest. yournsim Number simulations perform sample size increment (default 10). OR_cutoff_up Upper cutoff value odds ratio () (optional). OR_cutoff_down Lower cutoff value odds ratio () (optional). CCI Logical indicating whether consider cell change index (CCI) (default TRUE). interaction Logical indicating whether consider interaction effects (default FALSE). increased_sample_info method increase sample size, "rate" specified factors.

title: Simulate Power Curve with Increasing Sample Size — cwas_addSamples
text: simulated power curve plot specified cell type varying sample sizes.

code: cwas_allmodel_cal(cwas.data, link_function = "binomial")

text: cwas.data CWAS data containing model information. link_function link function use model fitting (default "binomial").

text: list model results cell type.

what: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
title: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
text: function takes list model dataframes generates heatmap visualize AIC values across different models.

title: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
code: cwas_allmodel_heatmap(mdlist, method = c("rank"))

title: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
text: mdlist list model dataframes. element list corresponds different cell type model type. method Character string specifying method use ranking. Currently supports "rank" (default) "AIC".

title: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
text: function processes model dataframe input list (mdlist), extracts relevant columns (formula, AIC, Pvalue, rank), combines single dataframe (alldata). cleans unnecessary columns, orders data, prepares heatmap plotting. P-values used annotate heatmap cells based significance levels.

title: Generate a heatmap of AIC values for multiple models — cwas_allmodel_heatmap
code: # Example usage: # cwas_allmodel_heatmap(list(model_data1, model_data2))

what: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
title: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
text: function automatically selects best model list models generates forest plot odds ratios (ORs).

title: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
code: cwas_autoselected_model(mdlist, method = c("Best"), interaction = F)

title: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
text: mdlist list models obtained previous analyses. method Method selecting best model ("Best", "Equally Best", "Integration") (default "Best"). "Best": Selects model lowest AIC (Akaike Information Criterion) value best model. "Equally Best": Computes multiple models equivalent AIC values based KL (Kullback-Leibler) information, selects model corrected positive results. "Integration": Integrates credible models derive combined inference. interaction Logical indicating whether consider interaction effects (default FALSE).

title: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
text: list containing selected best model additional information.

title: Automatically Select Best Model and Generate Forest Plot with Odds Ratios — cwas_autoselected_model
code: cwas_autoselected_model(cwas.test.data.single.model,method="Best") #> [1] "All models Selection" #> Error in autoselectedmodel_Best(mdlist): object 'cwas.test.data.single.model' not found

what: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
title: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
text: function prepares input data containing sample metadata, phenotype, cell type, optional additional variables standard format suitable subsequent analysis. input can Seurat object metadata dataframe. extracts necessary columns computes cell rates provided.

title: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
code: cwas_build_model_data(   inputdata,   Sample = "orig.ident",   Phenotype,   Celltype,   Group = NULL,   Subgroup = NULL,   Covariate1 = NULL,   Covariate2 = NULL,   selected_celltype = NULL,   Control_label = "Control",   Disease_label = "Disease",   Cellrate = NULL,   genelist = NULL,   geneset_score = NULL,   add_therapeutic_targets = F )

title: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
text: inputdata Seurat object metadata dataframe containing sample metadata, phenotype, cell type, optional additional variables. Sample column name specifying sample identifiers. Phenotype column name specifying phenotype variable. Celltype column name specifying cell type variable. Group (Optional) column name specifying group information. Subgroup (Optional) column name specifying subgroup information. Covariate1 (Optional) column name specifying first covariate. Covariate2 (Optional) column name specifying second covariate. selected_celltype (Optional) vector specific cell types include analysis. Control_label label representing control samples (default "Control"). Disease_label label representing disease samples (default "Disease"). Cellrate (Optional) column name specifying precomputed cell rates (available).

title: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
text: standardized dataframe suitable CWAS analysis, containing sample identifiers, phenotype, group information, subgroup information, covariates, cell rates.

title: Prepare CWAS Data for Modeling — cwas_build_model_data
code: cwas_build_model_data(inputdata = cwas.test,Sample = "GSM",Phenotype = "sample.condition",Celltype = "Subtype",Group = "GSE",Control_label="lymph.node",Disease_label="tumor",Cellrate = "Fraction") #> Error in cwas_build_model_data(inputdata = cwas.test, Sample = "GSM",     Phenotype = "sample.condition", Celltype = "Subtype", Group = "GSE",     Control_label = "lymph.node", Disease_label = "tumor", Cellrate = "Fraction"): Data file not found in the package, please reinstall the SPARKLE in the right path.

title: Perform Classic Comparison of Cell Proportions and Phenotypes — cwas_classic_comparision
text: function calculates classic comparisons cell proportions phenotypes based provided CWAS data.

code: cwas_classic_comparision(cwas.data)

title: Perform Classic Comparison of Cell Proportions and Phenotypes — cwas_classic_comparision

title: Perform Classic Comparison of Cell Proportions and Phenotypes — cwas_classic_comparision
text: list containing results statistical tests list plots cell type.

title: Perform Classic Comparison of Cell Proportions and Phenotypes — cwas_classic_comparision

title: Conduct CWAS Mediation Analysis — cwas_mediation_analysis
text: function conducts CWAS (Cell-type Weighted Analysis Single-cell data) mediation analysis based specified method.

title: Conduct CWAS Mediation Analysis — cwas_mediation_analysis
code: cwas_mediation_analysis(   cwas.data,   Best_model,   X.cell = NULL,   X.gene = NULL,   mediate.cell = NULL,   mediate.gene = NULL,   method = NULL,   num_cores = NULL,   fix_effect = NULL,   random_effect = NULL )

title: Conduct CWAS Mediation Analysis — cwas_mediation_analysis
text: cwas.data data frame containing CWAS results. Best_model best model selected mediation analysis. X.cell Vector specifying cell types used predictors mediation analysis. Default NULL. X.gene Vector specifying genes used predictors mediation analysis. Default NULL. mediate.cell Vector specifying cell types used mediators mediation analysis. mediate.gene Vector specifying genes used mediators mediation analysis. method method conducting mediation analysis. one "cell_mediate_cell", "gene_mediate_cell", "cell_mediate_gene". num_cores Number CPU cores used parallel computation. Default NULL.

title: Conduct CWAS Mediation Analysis — cwas_mediation_analysis
text: results CWAS mediation analysis.

what: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
text: function computes fixed effects models phenotype data using generalized linear models (GLMs) different link functions.

title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
code: cwas_model_cal_fix(   cwas.data,   selectedcelltype = "selectedcelltype_name",   link = "binomial" )

title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
text: cwas.data data frame containing phenotype data covariates. selectedcelltype character specifying selected cell type modeling. link link function use model. Default "binomial" logistic regression.

title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
text: list containing two elements: fitall list fitted model objects successfully computed. fitres_sorted data frame containing summary statistics fitted models, sorted AIC (Akaike Information Criterion).

title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
text: function fits series fixed effects models using generalized linear models (GLMs) stats package. models include combinations fixed effects (rate, covariates) different grouping structures (Subgroup, Group, Subgroup/Group). function attempts fit model captures successful results analysis. function outputs list fitted models (fitall) summary data frame (fitres_sorted) containing information model including model ID, cell type, formula, AIC, p-value (based rate coefficient).

title: CWAS Model Calculation for Fixed Effects — cwas_model_cal_fix
code: cwas_model_cal_fix(cwas.test.data) #> Error in cwas_model_cal_fix(cwas.test.data): object 'cwas.test.data' not found

what: Plot Heatmap of AIC Values and P-values for All Models — cwas_model_heatmap
title: Plot Heatmap of AIC Values and P-values for All Models — cwas_model_heatmap
text: function generates heatmap displaying AIC (Akaike Information Criterion) values P-values models.

title: Plot Heatmap of AIC Values and P-values for All Models — cwas_model_heatmap
code: cwas_model_heatmap(mdlist)

title: Plot Heatmap of AIC Values and P-values for All Models — cwas_model_heatmap
text: mdlist list models containing AIC values P-values.

title: Plot Heatmap of AIC Values and P-values for All Models — cwas_model_heatmap
code: cwas_model_heatmap(cwas.test.data.single.model) #> Error in cwas_model_heatmap(cwas.test.data.single.model): object 'cwas.test.data.single.model' not found

title: cwas_moderation_analysis — cwas_moderation_analysis
text: function performs moderation analysis cells genes. calculates moderation effects cells, genes, combination based specified method.

title: cwas_moderation_analysis — cwas_moderation_analysis
code: cwas_moderation_analysis(   cwas.data,   Best_model,   X.cell = NULL,   X.gene = NULL,   Moderation.cell = NULL,   Moderation.gene = NULL,   method = NULL,   num_cores = NULL )

title: cwas_moderation_analysis — cwas_moderation_analysis
text: cwas.data data frame containing input data analysis. Best_model model object containing information best model. X.cell string specifying cell type moderation effect analysis. Default NULL. X.gene string specifying gene moderation effect analysis. Default NULL. Moderation.cell string specifying moderating cell type. Default NULL. Moderation.gene string specifying moderating gene. Default NULL. method string specifying method use analysis. Acceptable values "cell_moderation_cell", "gene_moderation_cell", "cell_moderation_gene". num_cores integer specifying number cores use parallel computation. NULL, sequential computation performed. Default NULL.

title: cwas_moderation_analysis — cwas_moderation_analysis
text: object containing results moderation analysis.

title: cwas_moderation_analysis — cwas_moderation_analysis
text: method parameter "cell_moderation_cell", function performs cell--cell moderation effect analysis. method parameter "gene_moderation_cell", function performs gene--cell moderation effect analysis. Depending num_cores parameter, decides whether perform sequential parallel computation. method parameter "cell_moderation_gene", function performs cell--gene moderation effect analysis. Depending num_cores parameter, decides whether perform sequential parallel computation.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
text: function performs mediation analysis using cell types genes independent /mediating variables. processes input data leverages bruceR::PROCESS function conduct analysis.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
code: mediation_analysis_auto(   cwas.data,   Best_model,   X.cell = NULL,   X.gene = NULL,   Moderation.cell = NULL,   Moderation.gene = NULL,   nsim = 100,   seed = 1,   CI = "boot",   fix_effect = NULL,   random_effect = NULL )

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
text: cwas.data Data frame containing cell types, gene expression, phenotype data. Best_model List containing model selection information. X.cell Character. Name independent cell type variable. Default NULL. X.gene Character. Name independent gene variable. Default NULL. Moderation.cell Character. Name mediating cell type variable. Default NULL. Moderation.gene Character. Name mediating gene variable. Default NULL. nsim Integer. Number simulations. Default 100. seed Integer. Random seed reproducibility. Default 1. CI Character. Method confidence interval estimation. Default "boot". fix_effect Vector. Fixed effect covariates. Default NULL. random_effect Vector. Random effect covariates. Default NULL.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
text: list containing results mediation analysis bruceR::PROCESS function.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
text: function follows main steps: formula_process_string_vector: Helper function process formula strings. getfomula: Helper function extract formula information Best_model. Data preprocessing: Cleans formats data based specified independent mediating variables. Mediation analysis: Uses bruceR::PROCESS perform mediation analysis returns results. X.cell specified, function treat cell type independent variable. X.gene specified, treat gene independent variable. mediating variable can either cell type gene, specified Moderation.cell Moderation.gene respectively.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
text: Either X.cell X.gene must provided. X.gene used, Moderation.cell must specified. data frame cwas.data must contain Sample column merging operations.

title: Mediation Analysis Auto — mediation_analysis_auto
code: result <- mediation_analysis_auto(   cwas.data = cwas.test.data,   Best_model = cwas.test.data.single.model.best,   X.cell = "MTF",   Moderation.cell = "PIF",   Moderation.gene = "TGFB1",   nsim = 500,   seed = 42,   CI = "boot" ) #> Error in is.factor(x): object 'cwas.test.data' not found

code: Mediation_forest_plot(data)

title: Generate a Mediation Forest Plot — Mediation_forest_plot
text: data data frame containing necessary information plotting mediation forest plot.

title: Generate a Mediation Forest Plot — Mediation_forest_plot
text: mediation forest plot.

title: Moderation Analysis Function — moderation_analysis_auto
text: function performs moderation analysis CWAS data. supports different types moderation including cell-cell, gene-cell, gene-gene mediation effects.

title: Moderation Analysis Function — moderation_analysis_auto
code: moderation_analysis_auto(   cwas.data,   Best_model,   X.cell = NULL,   X.gene = NULL,   Moderation.cell = NULL,   Moderation.gene = NULL,   nsim = 1000,   seed = 1,   CI = "boot" )

title: Moderation Analysis Function — moderation_analysis_auto
text: cwas.data data frame containing CWAS data. Best_model list containing best model chosen analysis. X.cell character string specifying cell type used independent variable (IV). Default NULL. X.gene character string specifying gene used independent variable (IV). Default NULL. Moderation.cell character string specifying cell type used moderator. Default NULL. Moderation.gene character string specifying gene used moderator. Default NULL. nsim integer specifying number simulations bootstrapping. Default 1000. seed integer specifying seed random number generation. Default 1. CI character string specifying confidence interval method. Default "boot".

title: Moderation Analysis Function — moderation_analysis_auto
text: list containing results moderation analysis.

title: Moderation Forest Plot Function — Moderation_forest_plot
text: function generates forest plot moderation analysis results, highlighting significant effects.

title: Moderation Forest Plot Function — Moderation_forest_plot
code: Moderation_forest_plot(data)

title: Moderation Forest Plot Function — Moderation_forest_plot
text: data data frame containing results moderation analysis. data frame include columns model, effect size, confidence intervals, p-values.

title: Moderation Forest Plot Function — Moderation_forest_plot
text: forest plot object highlighting significant moderation effects customizable aesthetics.

title: OR Plot Function — OR_plot
text: function generates forest plot visualize odds ratios () confidence intervals (CI) provided data.

title: OR Plot Function — OR_plot
code: OR_plot(   data,   show_variable = c("Celltype", "Model", "OR(95%CI)", "P-value", "P-value adjusted"),   plot.position = 4,   Tablename = "Tablename" )

title: OR Plot Function — OR_plot
text: data list containing required data generating forest plot. show_variable character vector specifying variables display forest plot. Default c("Celltype", "Model", "(95%CI)", "P-value", "P-value adjusted"). plot.position integer specifying position insert empty space show_variable vector. Default 4, corresponds inserting empty space "P-value". Tablename character string specifying table name display forest plot header. Default "Tablename".

title: OR Plot Function — OR_plot
text: forest plot visualizing odds ratios confidence intervals based provided data.

title: OR Plot Function — OR_plot
code: # Example usage: OR_plot(data = cwas.test.data.single.model.best) #> Error in OR_plot(data = cwas.test.data.single.model.best): object 'cwas.test.data.single.model.best' not found
